Now, she said, “we must move boldly into the future”. Dressed in white in a nod to the suffragettes, Pelosi was greeted with cheers as she arrived for the hastily called address. She received a standing ovation when she closed, lawmakers and guests one by one crowding her with hugs, many taking selfies of a moment in history. President Joe Biden, who had encouraged Pelosi to stay on as Democratic leader, spoke with Pelosi in the morning and congratulated her on her historic tenure as speaker of the House.

“History will note she is the most consequential Speaker of the House of Representatives in our history,” Biden said in a statement, noting her ability to win unity from her caucus and her “absolute dignity”. It is an unusual choice for a party leader to stay on after withdrawing from congressional leadership, but not without precedent and Pelosi has long defied convention in pursuing power in Washington.

In an interview with reporters after her announcement, Pelosi said she will not endorse anyone in the race to succeed her and she will not sit on any committees as a rank-and-file lawmaker. She said the attack on her husband “made me think again about staying”. But in the end, after the election, she decided to step down. “I quite frankly, personally, have been ready to leave for a while,” she said. “Because there are things I want to do. I like to dance, I like to sing. There is a life out there, right?” During her remarks on the House floor, Pelosi recapped her career, from seeing the Capitol the first time as a young girl with her father -- a former New Deal congressman and mayor -- to serving as speaker alongside US presidents, noting three of the four, but not mentioning Donald Trump. “Every day I am in awe of the majestic miracle that is American democracy,” she said. At one point, she compared the better-than-expected showing for Democrats in the midterms, the first national election after the January 6, 2021 attack on the Capitol, as “proof through the night that our flag was still there”, drawing cheers from colleagues. The American historian Jon Meacham helped Pelosi with her speech, but an aide said she added that impromptu line herself. On short notice, lawmakers who have been waiting and wondering about the long-serving leader's plans filled the House, at least on the Democratic side, and Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer joined. He later joined a throng of lawmakers and hugged and kissed Pelosi on the cheek. The Speaker's Gallery was filled with Pelosi's staff and guests. Some Republicans, including some newly-elected members, also attended, though House Republican Leader Kevin McCarthy, who is seeking the speakership in the new Congress, did not, telling reporters afterward that he was “busy, unfortunately”. Pelosi was twice elected to the speakership and has led Democrats through consequential moments, including passage of the Affordable Care Act with President Barack Obama and the impeachments of President Donald Trump. Her decision on Thursday paves the way for House Democratic leadership elections next month when Democrats reorganise as the minority party for the new Congress. Pelosi's leadership team, with Majority Leader Steny Hoyer of Maryland and Democratic Whip James Clyburn of South Carolina, has long moved as a triumvirate. All now in their 80s, the three House Democratic leaders have faced restless colleagues eager for them to step aside and allow a new generation to take charge. Hoyer said after Pelosi's remarks that “it is the time for a new generation of leaders” and that he will also step down from leadership but stay in Congress. Clyburn, the highest-ranking Black American in Congress, has said he expects to stay in Congress next year and hopes to remain at the leadership table.
summary: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi announced she will not seek a leadership position in the new Congress, marking the end of her nearly 20-year tenure and historic role as the first woman to hold the gavel. In a speech following the midterm elections, Pelosi cited the need for new leadership after Democrats lost control of the House. Despite stepping down, she will continue to serve as the representative from San Francisco. Reflecting on her career, Pelosi emphasized the importance of American democracy and stated that the recent attack on her husband influenced her decision to leave leadership.

headline: Min temperature dips to 9.4 degrees
article:
New Delhi : The minimum temperature in the national Capital dropped below 10 degrees Celsius for the first time this season, falling to 9.4°C on Thursday, three notches below the normal for this time of the year and an unusual occurrence for this time of the year, weather scientists said.

“Normally, minimum temperatures don’t drop under 10 degree C in November. In recent years, in 2017, during the last week of November, the minimum temperature had dipped to 7.6 degree C. It’s unusual for minimum temperatures to drop to single digit in mid November. Winter is setting in early this year,” said Kuldeep Shrivastava, head, regional weather forecasting centre.

In 2019 the lowest November temperature was 11.4 degree C and in 2018 it was 10.5 degree C.

The maximum temperature on Thursday stood at 25.6°C, two degrees below normal.

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) had on Monday forecast that minimum temperatures would fall under the 10°C mark this week because of cold winds blowing in from the direction of the snow-clad western Himalayas. The weather forecaster also expects mercury levels to dip further from Sunday. “We are seeing a dip in minimum temperatures across northwest India and expect temperatures to dip further from November 22, when a western disturbance is likely to affect the western Himalayan region,” Srivastava added.
summary: Delhi experienced an unusually early winter chill as temperatures dipped to 9.4°C on November 19, marking the first sub-10°C reading of the season. This is three degrees below the typical minimum for mid-November. Weather officials say it’s uncommon for temperatures to drop this low so early, indicating an early onset of winter. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) had predicted this change due to cold winds from the western Himalayas. More cold is expected in the coming days as a western disturbance approaches. Comparatively, previous years saw higher minimums in November, highlighting the significance of this drop.

headline: Gold faces resistance at $2000-2010 amidst mixed market Signals: What next for gold?
article:
Second is the geopolitical landscape still contains an excessive amount of uncertainty and risk due to the war in the Middle East and Ukraine although the war premium has eroded.
By Bhavik Patel
Gold is near to its resistance zone of $2000-2010 and the upside momentum is drifting sideways because of lack of fresh triggers. However gold is expected to remain positive on back of various combinations of factors. One of them is being expectations that the Federal Reserve might have concluded raising interest rates.

Second is the geopolitical landscape still contains an excessive amount of uncertainty and risk due to the war in the Middle East and Ukraine although the war premium has eroded. Third, a report by the World Gold Council revealed intensified buying by central banks around the world resulting in a new record for purchases in the first nine months of the year. Lastly, except for the Federal Reserve, global central banks are predicting a path in 2024 for cutting rates.
summary: Geopolitical tensions persist from conflicts in the Middle East and Ukraine, impacting gold near its $2000-2010 resistance zone. Despite sideways momentum due to limited triggers, positive trends are expected, buoyed by the Fed's potential rate stance. Central banks' increased gold buying sets new records, contrasting with other banks' 2024 rate-cut predictions.

headline: Abu Salem gets 7-year rigorous imprisonment in fake passport case
article:
Hyderabad: A special Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) court in Hyderabad on Thursday awarded seven-year rigorous imprisonment to extradited gangster, Abu Salem , in a fake passport case.

The 3rd special court judge for CBI cases, M.V. Ramana Naidu, had on 18 November held the underworld don guilty under different sections of Indian Penal Code (IPC) for obtaining a passport under a fictitious name and address from Kurnool district of Andhra Pradesh.

Salem, convicted earlier for criminal conspiracy and cheating under the IPC, was sentenced to seven years rigorous imprisonment (RI) and fined ₹ 1,000 for each of the charge. Salem, also convicted on the charge of forgery for the purpose of cheating, was sentenced to one-year RI, and also slapped with ₹ 1,000 fine. He was also sentenced to one-year RI each on the charges of cheating by personation and for using a forged document as genuine.

All the sentences will run concurrently.

“Salem has completed a term of around six years of imprisonment in the case," CBI’s senior public prosecutor T.V. Ramana said. Salem was present in the court when the judgment was pronounced. After the verdict, he was taken back to Mumbai by the jail authorities of Mumbai.

Salem had procured the fake passport in 2001 under the fictitious identity of Ramil Kamil Malik by submitting forged documents to the Hyderabad Regional Passport Office, in connivance with some government officials and private persons.

headline: 12 Wickets tumble on day 1 of D/N Test match
article:
The opening day of the first day-night cricket test was as lively as organizers could have wished for with the pink ball swinging under lights and the crowd swelling to 47,441 as Australia struggled to stumps at 54-2 after bowling New Zealand out for 202 on Friday.

Skipper Steve Smith (24) and Adam Voges (9) were unbeaten after David Warner (1) was dismissed in the fourth over, and Joe Burns (14) was out in the 14th of the 22 overs Australia had to navigate.

New Zealand started positively after Brendon McCullum won the toss in the historic match at the Adelaide Oval, reaching 80-2 in the first session and Tom latham posting a half century after play started at 2 p.M. local time. But Australia took five wickets in the second session and finished off New Zealand within nine overs after the first dinner interval in test cricket.

Starc returned 3-24 before leaving the field with an ankle injury and heading to a hospital for scans, leaving Australia team masseur Grant Baldwin to fill in as a substitute fielder.

It was the only setback in the middle session for the Australians, who took five wickets  including three for four runs within 11 balls, all caught behind by Peter Nevill — to remove latham (50), Ross Taylor (21), McCullum (4), Mitch Santner, who scored 31 and Craig (11).

latham raised his half century with a cut boundary against lyon in the over before tea but didn't add to his total after interval, when a ceremony to mark the first anniversary of former Australia batsman Phillip Hughes' death was held at 4:08 p.m.
summary:
The opening day of the first-ever day-night Test match was action-packed and well-attended, with 47,441 spectators at Adelaide Oval. New Zealand, after winning the toss, were bowled out for 202 despite a solid start and a half-century from Tom Latham. Australia’s bowlers dominated the second session, taking five key wickets, including three quick dismissals caught behind by Peter Nevill.

Mitchell Starc took 3-24 before leaving with an ankle injury. Australia ended the day at 54-2, with Steve Smith (24\*) and Adam Voges (9\*) at the crease. David Warner and Joe Burns were dismissed early. A tribute to Phillip Hughes was held at 4:08 p.m., marking the anniversary of his death.

headline: Govt claims victory at WTO
article:
NEW DELHI: The government on Friday claimed victory at the World Trade Organization after members agreed to grant full immunity to developing countries against a possible breach of subsidy ceilings.
“…we have been able to secure an outcome that addresses our concerns… We have accomplished this without any concessions, compromise or new conditions,” commerce and industry minister Nirmala Sitharaman told Parliament. Stating that the “new and unambiguous” decision endorsed by the WTO membership will remain in perpetuity till a solution is found, she said it will also give flexibility to countries such as India in continuing their minimum support price policy.
Last year, in Bali, WTO members, including India, had agreed to finalize a new formula for calculating domestic support by 2017 and said any breach of the permissible 10% ceiling will not be challenged at the multilateral body during this period. In return, they agreed to sign the trade facilitation agreement (TFA) to usher in easier customs rules.

But after taking charge, the BJP government refused to sign TFA, arguing that it wanted a permanent solution. It, however, agreed to sign it after the US and others offered additional comfort by extending the four-year peace clause to perpetuity.

“This would do away with any ambiguity on this aspect as well as guard against the possibility of no cover being available after 2017 in case a permanent solution on public stockholding for food security purposes is not arrived at by then,” the minister said.

At the same time, WTO members have agreed to work out a permanent solution by December 2015. While there are fears that India will be asked to undertake additional commitments, Sitharaman suggested that this may not be the case.
summary: The government of India claimed victory at the World Trade Organization (WTO) as members agreed to grant full immunity to developing countries against a possible breach of subsidy ceilings. Commerce and Industry Minister Nirmala Sitharaman stated that this decision will remain in perpetuity until a permanent solution is found, providing flexibility to countries like India to continue their minimum support price policy. Last year, WTO members had agreed to finalize a new formula for calculating domestic support by 2017, with any breach of the permissible 10% ceiling not to be challenged during this period. However, the BJP government refused to sign the trade facilitation agreement (TFA) until a permanent solution was found. The US and others offered additional comfort by extending the four-year peace clause to perpetuity, leading to India agreeing to sign the TFA. The minister suggested that India may not be asked to undertake additional commitments as WTO members work towards a permanent solution by December 2015.

headline: Modi Cabinet 2024
article: The Modi 3.0 Cabinet, sworn in on June 9, 2024, at Rashtrapati Bhavan, comprises 72 ministers—making it the second-largest Council of Ministers in India's history. Prime Minister Narendra Modi retains key portfolios like Personnel, Atomic Energy, and Space. Prominent Cabinet Ministers include Rajnath Singh (Defence), Amit Shah (Home Affairs and Co-operation), Nirmala Sitharaman (Finance and Corporate Affairs), Nitin Gadkari (Road Transport and Highways), and S. Jaishankar (External Affairs). Former Chief Ministers like Shivraj Singh Chouhan (Agriculture and Rural Development), Manohar Lal Khattar (Power and Urban Affairs), and H.D. Kumaraswamy (Heavy Industries and Steel) have joined the Cabinet. J.P. Nadda returned as Minister for Health and Chemicals & Fertilisers. Other key figures include Piyush Goyal (Commerce), Ashwini Vaishnaw (Railways, IT, and I&B), and Dharmendra Pradhan (Education). New and young faces such as Kinjarapu Rammohan Naidu (Civil Aviation) and Chirag Paswan (Food Processing) have been included. Additionally, five Ministers of State hold independent charges, including Jitendra Singh (Science & Technology) and Arjun Ram Meghwal (Law & Justice), while 36 others serve as Ministers of State across various departments. This cabinet showcases a blend of experience, regional balance, and alliance representation within the NDA government.
summary: The Modi 3.0 Cabinet was sworn in on June 9, 2024, at Rashtrapati Bhavan, comprising 72 ministers, making it the second-largest Council of Ministers in India’s history. Prime Minister Narendra Modi retains key portfolios including Personnel, Atomic Energy, and Space. The Cabinet features several senior leaders such as Rajnath Singh (Defence), Amit Shah (Home Affairs and Co-operation), Nirmala Sitharaman (Finance and Corporate Affairs), Nitin Gadkari (Road Transport and Highways), and S. Jaishankar (External Affairs). Former Chief Ministers Shivraj Singh Chouhan, Manohar Lal Khattar, and H.D. Kumaraswamy have been inducted, handling crucial portfolios like Agriculture, Power, and Heavy Industries respectively. J.P. Nadda returns as the Minister for Health and Chemicals & Fertilisers. The Cabinet also includes key figures like Piyush Goyal (Commerce), Ashwini Vaishnaw (Railways, IT, and I&B), and Dharmendra Pradhan (Education). New faces such as Kinjarapu Rammohan Naidu (Civil Aviation) and Chirag Paswan (Food Processing) reflect the government’s youth representation. Additionally, five Ministers of State hold independent charges, while 36 serve as MoS across departments. The Cabinet emphasizes a balance of experience, generational diversity, and alliance representation, marking a strategic and inclusive composition within the NDA government.

headline: Sena’s quiet warrior
article: Thackeray may not be as flamboyant as his father and Shiv Sena founder Balasaheb Thackeray but was hand-held by him in lessons of fearlessness. Stories abound of how Thackeray senior, a fan of herpetology, introduced him to a world of snakes and reptiles. Politics is nothing but a snake pit and Uddhav, therefore, comes suitably prepared for the slithery swamp that the new Maharashtra alliance he is leading with the Nationalist Party Congress (NCP) and the Congress could become. The Maharashtra Vikas Aghadi is a melange of ideologies. Ideologies that have made it through the elections by positing themselves against each other. But Uddhav has survived every time, wriggling around problems and biting, too, at rivals when needed. But with a studied, reasoned crawl rather than a race. Post Balasaheb, he has quietly helmed the Sena, which was preyed on by an aggressive BJP eager to expand its footprint. And then compromised by his cousin, the charismatic Raj, who people believe is more like Thackeray senior, but had to be content with a rebellious outfit. The Sena may have chosen the BJP as a convenient ally but has always been its watchdog, particularly cornering it on unkept promises and maintaining the big push on Hindutva’s symbolism, Ayodhya. There was a time when everybody had begun to believe that the Sena would be wiped out in the face of the BJP’s onslaught and at best could be a tag-along. Yet, Uddhav held on to the job he knew and cultivated the Marathi pride to get 56 seats, creditable enough to bargain with the BJP, which had slumped to 105. Although many wondered if the Sena was using a bit of fair weather to push for chief ministership, Uddhav kept on insisting that the “son of Balasaheb never lies” and that a rotational chief ministership was indeed discussed with the BJP in pre-poll talks. The BJP, while denying ever promising this, did shuffle its feet on whether it was discussed at all. Uddhav persisted till his claim rang sincere. And for all the poaching expeditions that characterise opportunistic coalitions, Uddhav’s men did not desert him and held fort with a Shivaji-like defiance. Neither did they hold a State to ransom with agitations and strikes to press home their point, knowing full well that if NCP indeed propped up the BJP instead, the party would wilt away under the BJP’s vindictive backlash. It is this quiet patience that might be recontouring the Sena in the long term.
summary: Uddhav Thackeray, though not as flamboyant as his father Balasaheb Thackeray, inherits fearlessness and resilience. Leading the Maharashtra Vikas Aghadi, he navigates through political challenges with a reasoned approach. Despite facing BJP's aggression, he maintains Sena's identity and upholds Marathi pride, securing a significant seat share. Uddhav's sincerity and steadfastness reshape Sena's trajectory, marking a departure from aggressive tactics to patient persistence.

headline: Indian-American Neera Tandon gets key Cabinet post in Joe Biden’s financial team
article:
Washington: US President-elect Joe Biden has named Janet Yellen as his Treasury Secretary and Indian-American Neera Tanden as Director of Office of Management and Budget. Joe Biden announced key members of his economic team. If confirmed by the US Senate, Yellen, 74, will be the first woman to lead the Treasury Department in its 231-year history. She will be the first person to have served as Treasury Secretary, Chair of the Council of Economic Advisers, and Chair of the Federal Reserve. She has previously been confirmed by the Senate on four separate occasions.

Tanden, 50, if confirmed by the Senate, would be the first woman of colour and first Indian-American to lead the Office of Management and Budget (OMB). Tanden’s career has focused on pursuing policies designed to support working families, foster broad-based economic growth, and curb rampant inequality.
“Another proud day for Indian Americans to see Neera Tanden be nominated for a Cabinet level position in the next administration. This position at OMB is a wide-ranging role with broad powers to manage trillions of dollars of the US budget. If anyone had any doubts that our community has arrived politically, this election cycle is proof enough,” Indiaspora founder MR Rangaswami, and an eminent philanthropist and venture capitalist, told this agency.

Announcing key members of his economic team, Biden also named Wally Adeyemo, as Deputy Secretary of the Treasury; Cecilia Rouse as Chair of the Council of Economic Advisers; and Jared Bernstein and Heather Boushey, as members of the Council of Economic Advisers. Biden would formally introduce his team Tuesday.

This crisis-tested team will help Biden administration lift America out of the current economic downturn and build back better — creating an economy that gives every single person across America a fair shot and an equal chance to get ahead, the transition said.

“As we get to work to control the virus, this is the team that will deliver immediate economic relief for the American people during this economic crisis and help us build our economy back better than ever,” Biden said in a statement.

This team is comprised of respected and tested groundbreaking public servants who will help the communities hardest hit by COVID-19 and address the structural inequities in our economy, he said.

“They will work tirelessly to ensure every American enjoys a fair return for their work and an equal chance to get ahead, and that our businesses can thrive and out-compete the rest of the world. This team looks like America and brings seriousness of purpose, the highest degree of competency, and unwavering belief in the promise of America. They will be ready on day one to get to work for all Americans,’ Biden said.

According to Vice President-elect Kamala Harris, this outstanding economic team will help the Biden administration deliver on its commitment. “They are not only some of America’s most brilliant economic minds, they are also proven leaders who reflect the very best of our country,” she said.
summary: US President-elect Joe Biden has appointed Janet Yellen as Treasury Secretary and Neera Tanden as Director of the Office of Management and Budget (OMB). If confirmed, Yellen will become the first woman to lead the Treasury Department, while Tanden will be the first woman of color and Indian-American to head OMB. Biden's economic team also includes Wally Adeyemo as Deputy Treasury Secretary and Cecilia Rouse as Chair of the Council of Economic Advisers. Biden emphasized that the team will work to lift America out of the economic downturn, tackle inequality, and ensure economic fairness for all Americans.

headline: Flaws in prison security
article:
Punjab jail-break is only one of many incidents

The recent incident of Nabha jail-break by Harminder Singh Mintoo, the chief of the banned Khalistan liberation Force (KlF), is shocking. However, a joint operation team of the Delhi and Punjab police which caught him immediately after a day, showed how alert our security forces were. Reports say that Mintoo was in touch with Pakistan-based terror outfits, the senior officials of the Pakistan Army and, most importantly, with the Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI). These are all old gameplans of Pakistan, through which the country has been trying either to shift its nefarious plans from Jammu & Kashmir to Punjab or to solely focus on vulnerable points with the help of militants based in its territory.

Sources say that Pakistan's harbouring of the Khalistani terror organisations like the Babbar Khalsa International, the Khalistan Tiger's Force (Nijjar-led), the International Sikh Youth Federation and the Khalistan Zindabad Force, is only encouraging such incidents to revive the old terror. Sensing this, the Government of India, particularly the States that are vulnerable to Islamist militancy, should take extraordinary precautionary measures to thwart these kinds of episodes in our jails. It must not be treated only as an instance of security lapse, but also needs to be examined as a huge network that the Pakistan-based Islamists have built with the inmates of Indian jails over the years. Thus, the Mintoo saga and another one that took place in Madhya Prdesh in the same month, should not be simply brushed aside as a seasonal incident. It must be taken as a wake-up call by the prison authorities across India. Also, prisons should not be left entirely to the States, just because prison is listed as a State subject.

The National Crime Records Bureau in its 2015 report stated that more than 27,000 jail vacancies exist as against the sanctioned strength of a little over 80,000. This reflects that there has been a severe staff crunch in the prisons of the country. The report also says that more than 200 inmates escaped in the incidents of jail-break and from custody in 2015. Punjab has a record of more than 41 per cent vacancies in its jails; in 2015, 32 inmates escaped. Apart from this, the report highlighted that vacancies are ranging from the level of ordinary constables to the rank of officers. It is sad that Delhi, which boasts of the country's most high-security Tihar jail, is the third worst when it comes to staff crunch.

The Tihar jail has more than 47 per cent staff vacancies. Ironically, Delhi is currently housing the most overcrowded jails of the country where 200 inmates are being kept, as against a sanctioned strength of 100. Both the Union and the State Governments have to be more tuned in to the basic concerns with regard to adequate jail staff and the number of inmates. Else, jail-breaks will happen. We need an effective and efficient superintendence and maintenance of jails. It is found that since the coming of the ‘Model Prison Manual' in 2003, which was circulated to all the States and Union Territories, very few of the jails have so far adopted it in true spirit. It must be brought to the notice of the public that this manual was made after wide consultations with the State Governments. It is time to tighten our jail security and review the current staff requirements.
summary: The recent jail-break incident at Nabha involving Harminder Singh Mintoo, the leader of Khalistan Liberation Force, highlights serious security concerns in Indian prisons. Mintoo's swift recapture by a joint operation of Delhi and Punjab police underscores vigilance, but also exposes vulnerabilities. Reports suggest links between Mintoo and Pakistan-based terror outfits, indicating broader security threats. The incident urges Indian authorities to enhance prison security nationwide, address staffing shortages, and implement the 'Model Prison Manual' effectively to prevent future escapes and strengthen inmate management.

headline: Rupee to trade in 62-63 range without RBI measures: Assocham
article:
The rupee is unlikely to fall below 63 to a dollar even if the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) withdraws temporary measures such as direct sale of dollars to oil importing companies and the foreign currency non-resident (FCNR) swap facility put in place to support the currency, as speculative activity around it has mostly ebbed in the foreign exchange market, according to a paper released by the Associated Chambers of Commerce and Industry of India (Assocham).

Besides, foreign institutional investors (FIIs) have turned buyers in the capital market and exports have made an impressive rebound — the developments that would lend support to the rupee, which will trade in the range of 62-63, the paper says.

Worries on current account deficit (CAD) have also gone away, and Finance Minister P. Chidambaram has already stated that CAD for the current fiscal would not be more than $60 billion, the paper adds.

“All these positives now set a stage for the RBI for a possible withdrawal of the measures,” the paper says.

“Today, India is much better in terms of its macroeconomic indicators — be it government finances or the overall balance of payments situation,” the paper adds.

The FCNR deposit swap facility, which has already raked in more than $13 billion to the country’s forex kitty, is likely to bring in $20 billion directly to the sovereign treasury when the facility ends by November 30.

Besides, the RBI may end the direct dollar access to the oil importing companies even earlier.

It is only then that the real strength of the rupee will be decided by free market forces, “but we are sure that these market forces are now poised in favour of the Indian currency than the U.S. greenback,” the paper points out.
summary:
The article discusses the rupee's expected trading range of 62-63 against the US dollar without the intervention of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), as suggested by the Associated Chambers of Commerce and Industry of India (Assocham). In essence, Assocham believes that the Indian currency will remain stable within this range without the need for RBI's corrective measures. 

This prediction suggests confidence in the Indian economy's stability and resilience, indicating that external factors and economic conditions are conducive to a steady exchange rate. Such a range can be beneficial for businesses, as it provides a predictable environment for trade and investments. It also implies that the rupee's value is expected to be robust enough to withstand fluctuations and external pressures.

However, it's essential to keep in mind that currency markets can be influenced by a variety of factors, including economic data, geopolitical events, and global trends. While Assocham's forecast is positive, it's not an absolute guarantee, and the actual exchange rate will still depend on the dynamic interplay of these factors. Businesses and investors should continue to monitor the forex market and adapt their strategies accordingly, even within the projected range.

headline: Mobile application ‘Meitei’ launched
article:
A social networking mobile application called ‘Meitei’, created by Manipur Digital, was launched at Soibam Leikai Ayangpalli Road Youth Club (SAYC) community hall on Sunday.

Speaking on the occasion, social activist Maheshwor Thounaojam pointed out that the conflict had revealed certain information about the state’s political and social affairs.

“It has awakened the people, especially the Meitei community and renewed the zeal to carry Manipur towards a prosperous direction,” he said.

He exuded confidence that the newly launched mobile application would play a proactive role in connecting all Meiteis in different pockets of the globe.

“People questioning the Meiteis’ integrity and unity are only talking nonsense. This conflict was a crucial ingredient in strengthening the Meitei’s unity,” he said.

He exhorted people to carry this momentum forward and stated that the software application would be beneficial in maintaining the momentum.
summary: The 'Meitei' social networking app, developed by Manipur Digital, was unveiled at an event in Manipur. Social activist Maheshwor Thounaojam highlighted that recent conflicts have increased awareness about the state's political and social issues, fostering unity among the Meitei community. He expressed confidence in the app's role in connecting Meiteis globally and urged people to leverage the platform for continued momentum and unity.

headline: Discriminatory wall blocking access to road since 2019, says man, seeks TN govt intervention
article:
THOOTHUKUDI: Laying claim to public roads, pattadars constructed a wall concealing the entrance gates of three houses in Mathavankurichi village near Udangudi. Meanwhile, the occupants of the house have alleged that they are being discriminated against by the perpetrators and urged the district administration to demolish the wall.

In a petition, S Malmarugan, a businessman, said he built a house south of the Thandavankadu-Kulasekarapattinam state highway. However, one Alaguvel built a wall in 2019 blocking the gate of his house and claimed ownership of 2.5 cents of land between Malmarugan’s house and the road.

Sources said the Thandavankadu-Kulasekarapattinam road is supposed to be 53 feet wide. However, pattadars have encroached upon 10 feet of land in front of Malmarugan’s house, and another 30 feet outside the houses near the Mutharaman temple. The width of the state highways has been reduced to 13 feet in front of Malmarugan's house, sources added.

Following litigation and complaints, the Tiruchendur revenue divisional officer (RDO), in an executive order dated October 1, had ruled that the patta for the road was illegal as the occupants did not provide any supporting documents other than a patta and parent documents during inquiries. While the illegal patta names 11 members, many of them had moved away and admitted that they did not have any documents. However, Alaguvel, a relative of one of the pattadars, had claimed ownership, the RDO said.

The RDO's executive order also noted that reports of the village administrative officer, tahsildar, and block development officer (BDO) prove that the supposed land remained unused by the claimants, and was used as a pathway by the general public before and after UDR. Alaguvel does not possess any parent document for the land, and hence, this land should remain as a road, the RDO ruled and also ordered the claimants to appeal against the order within 30 days to the district revenue officer.

Assistant director (Panchayat) S Ulaganathan, on October 17, directed the Udangudi BDO to cancel the permission given to build the wall and restore it as a pathway as it was used before 2019. However, no action was taken.
Speaking to TNIE, Malmarugan said he belongs to the Servaikarar sect of the Shannar community, while Alaguvel belongs to the Nadar community.

Malmarugan, one of the state secretaries of Tamil Manila Congress, said Alaguvel often comes near his house and verbally abuses him for hailing from an ‘inferior’ community. "Why do you use the name Nadar?" Alaguvel can be heard shouting at Malmarugan in a video, which the latter also submitted to the Kulasekarapattinam police demanding action. "The officials refuse to demolish the wall citing law and order issues. The district administration and the police must demolish the wall and ensure social justice," Malmarugan said.
summary:
A contentious land dispute, exacerbated by alleged caste discrimination, has erupted in Mathavankurichi village, Thoothukudi, where a wall constructed on a public road is blocking access to three houses. S Malmarugan, a businessman, claims a relative of a pattadar, Alaguvel, built the wall in 2019, asserting ownership of 2.5 cents of land.

The Thandavankadu-Kulasekarapattinam state highway, intended to be 53 feet wide, has been severely narrowed to just 13 feet in front of Malmarugan's house due to this and other encroachments. The Tiruchendur Revenue Divisional Officer (RDO) had, on October 1, 2024, ruled the patta for the road illegal, confirming it was a public pathway. This order also stated that Alaguvel lacked parent documents for the land and ordered the land to remain a road.

Despite the RDO's executive order and a subsequent directive from the Assistant Director (Panchayat) on October 17, 2024, to demolish the wall, no action has been taken. Malmarugan, belonging to the Servaikarar sect of the Shannar community, alleges that Alaguvel, from the Nadar community, verbally abuses him with casteist slurs. Malmarugan, a state secretary of Tamil Manila Congress, has appealed to the district administration and police for intervention, stating that officials are hesitant to act due to "law and order issues" and urging them to ensure social justice.

headline: Rupee ends barely changed against dollar
article: mumbai: the rupee ended barely changed against the greenback on wednesday in yet another session of extremely thin and lethargic trade at the interbank foreign exchange (forex) market. after being confined to a tight one paisa band of 47.9750 and 47.9850 per dollar in muted business, the rupee closed at 47.9775/9825, a shade higher from the previous finish of 47.9800/9850. it opened at 47.9750/9850. the forex spot trade remained subdued and within a tight groove due to lack of market moving factors. steady dollar supplies from exporters and foreign funds were seen giving the rupee an underlying support but mild dollar demand from public sector banks prevented it from rising sharply, a forex dealer said. the market remained unmoved by the overnight 50 basis points cut in the us federal reserve rates, they added. "extremely thin volumes and the absence of any pressure on both the demand and supply side kept the forex spot trade sandwiched in a tight one paisa band, lacking clear market direction," a forex dealer commented. "i don't see much change in the trading pattern tomorrow also, as the rupee will remain rock-steady," he added. the reserve bank of india (rbi) fixed the reference rate at 47.98 per dollar, as against 47.97 on tuesday. in cross currency trades, the rupee declined against euro and remained distinctly weak against the british sterling. the indian currency ended sharply lower against the single european unit at 43.34/36 per euro from tuesday's finish of 43.08/10 after opening on a positive note at 43.00/02 per euro. resuming softer against sterling at 70.01/03 per pound from 69.95/97, the rupee dipped further at the close to 70.34/36 per pound. the futures market was moderately active and forward dollar premiums rose sharply on renewed heavy paying pressure following the 50 basis points cut in us federal reserve rates. "interest rate differentials between the us and india led banks and corporates to cover their forward exposures, resulting in a sharp rise in premiums," a dealer said. the benchmark six-months forward dollar premiums payable at the end of april closed at 146-145 paise, higher from tuesday's closing levels of 144-142 paise.
summary: The Indian rupee remained nearly unchanged against the US dollar, closing at 47.9775/9825 in a session characterized by thin and lethargic trade. The market lacked direction due to minimal activity and the absence of significant factors. Despite steady dollar supplies, mild demand from public sector banks prevented a sharp rise. The Reserve Bank of India set the reference rate at 47.98 per dollar. In cross currency trades, the rupee declined against the euro and weakened against the British pound. The futures market saw increased activity with rising forward dollar premiums following a 50 basis points cut in US Federal Reserve rates.

headline: Modi will be remembered as protector of Indian economy: Chamber
article:
Madurai: History will remember Prime Minister Narendra Modi as the protector of Indian economy, said senior president of Tamil Nadu Chamber of Commerce and Industry S. Rethinavelu.

Welcoming the Union Government's announcement of demonetisation of Rs.500 and Rs. 1000 currency notes, he said it would root out black money, counterfeit currencies and also eradicate bribe. The supply channel to fundamentalists will also be cut down, he said.

Stating that most of the bribe money is given only by tax-evaders, he said honest tax payers are not able to pay bribe and therefore they are not able to get their rightful services from various sectors.

Mr. Rethinavelu said that the Government could mobilise only Rs. 62,000 crores through the voluntary disclosure of income scheme that ended in September. "When the Prime Minister said that stern action will be taken against those hoarding black money, people thought it was a usual threat and nothing will happen going by the past experiences. However, Modi has now proven that he practises what he preaches," Mr. Rethinavelu said.

He expected that the prices of various commodities and services will come down as black money had been playing its ugly part in abnormal increase of price. Black money was almost a parallel economy threatening to lead to collapse of the nation's economy. But, Mr. Modi has stopped that. He will be remembered as protector of Indian economy, he said.

Though people might face some inconvenience for two or three days, they will realise the benefits of the present move very soon.
summary: Madurai: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will be remembered as the protector of the Indian economy, according to S. Rethinavelu, senior president of the Tamil Nadu Chamber of Commerce and Industry. Welcoming the demonetisation of Rs. 500 and Rs. 1000 currency notes, he praised the move for targeting black money, counterfeit currencies, and bribes. Rethinavelu noted that black money had significantly inflated prices and functioned as a parallel economy. He expressed confidence that the inconvenience faced by the public would be temporary and that the long-term benefits would soon be realized.

headline: Appointment of 8 PSU bank heads expected by Nov-end
article:
The finance ministry said on Friday that the government will, by November-end, appoint chairman and managing directors of eight Public Sector Banks (PSB), where it had scrapped selections made by the UPA government.

The ministry also said it will soon take to the union cabinet level a proposal for a R10,000 crore fund for recapitalisation of public sector banks (PSBs) in addition to the R11,200 crore announced in the Budget 2014-15 to help them meet global capital adequacy or Basel III norms. Besides, the ministry said the government will from next fiscal give more autonomy to PSBs in selecting statutory auditors.

Addressing mediapersons, Department of financial services secretary GS Sandhu said panel led by RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan, and comprising Sandhu himself alongwith four external experts will on November 13 and 14 conduct interviews of eligible candidates for the post of CMDs of eight PSBs. He added that the aim is to hand over appointment letters to the selected candidates by November-end.


Sandhu said before the final decision is taken, each of the eligible candidates will have to appear before three sub-committees comprising two members each from a panel of six members (including DFS secretary, RBI deputy governor, and four experts). They will be assessed including on the basis of their performance in the last 10 years, Sandhu said.
summary: The finance ministry announced it will appoint chairmen and managing directors for eight Public Sector Banks by November-end, replacing earlier UPA-era selections. A high-level panel led by RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan will conduct interviews. Additionally, a ₹10,000 crore recapitalization proposal and increased autonomy in auditor selection for PSBs are planned to help meet Basel III capital norms.

headline: Birthday gift: Ambanis likely to lend corporate hand in cleaning ghats of Varanasi
article:
As a precursor to Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s maiden visit Varanasi on November 7 and 8, Reliance Industries chief Mukesh Ambani celebrated a grand 51st birthday for wife Nita in the PM’s constituency. A liberal sprinkling of religious fervor, comprising of a visit to the world-famous Kashi Vishwanath Temple to perform Rudrabhishek ceremony and a trip to the famous Dashashwamedh Ghat to see the Ganga Aarti, has been packaged with a grand stay at the Nadesar Palace, the erstwhile home of the King of Kashi, which has hosted among royalty, statesmen and celebrities, including Britain?s Queen Elizabeth, which is now part of the Taj group?s hotels.

While the guest list was a closely guarded secret till late evening, the buzz was afloat that after seeing the Ganga Arrti, the entire Ambani family comprising of mother Kokilaben, children, close friends and senior Reliance Industries officials, will attend the colourful birthday party that is to be celebrated at Gulab Bagh of the Taj Hotel. There was tight security at the hotel and no outsider was allowed to enter the premises. ?All the employees of Taj hotel had been asked to deposit their mobiles with the management, so that they are not able to share any details,? said a source at the hotel, adding that the hotel and the ghats have been decorated extensively for the event.

Earlier in the day, three chartered planes landed at the Varanasi airport carrying the Ambani family and friends who had come to take part in the birthday party.
summary: Mukesh Ambani hosted a lavish 51st birthday celebration for wife Nita Ambani in Varanasi, ahead of PM Modi’s visit. The event included religious rituals at Kashi Vishwanath Temple and Ganga Aarti at Dashashwamedh Ghat, followed by a private party at the historic Nadesar Palace. Security was tight, and guest details were kept confidential throughout the celebration.

headline: New Year: Housefull: Tourists In Mp To Ring In Ny
article: Indore: Hotels across Madhya Pradesh are packed to capacity as large number of tourists are in state to ring in the New Year — shrugging off pandemic woes despite fresh rise in cases across the country.Though there were a few room cancellations in past weeks by tourists from Maharashtra and Delhi, they were soon booked online by local tourists, officials from tourism department said.At almost all tourist destinations across the state, rooms owned by Madhya Pradesh Tourism Development Corporation (MPTDC) have been sold out from December 31 until the first week of January. MPTDC MD S Vishwanathan said, “This year, a large number of tourists are visiting the state to celebrate New Year. This is a very positive sign for the hospitality industry. All our rooms have been sold out. Apart from our resorts, occupancy in private resorts is also over 90%. We have added a lot of attractions and activities to lure tourists in the state and that has yielded results.”Highest tourist footfall for New Year festivities was recorded at national parks, Pachmarhi, Orchha, Chanderi, Sailani, Hanuwantiya, Maheshwar, Gandhi Sagar, Mandu, Choral, Gwalior, Shivpuri, Tawa, Madhai and Ujjain with almost 100 per hotel occupancy. MPTDC has included adventure and sport tourism activities at a few of their properties for the long holiday season.Apart from local tourists, the state that ranks 8th in the country in number of domestic tourists visiting it and shares 4.5% of the total tourist footfall, has recorded bookings from Gujarat, Kolkata, Maharashtra and Delhi. “We have stopped taking bookings because we are full to capacity. Tent city and New Year eve party was totally sold out for December 31 and January 1 though occupancy is extremely high until the first week of January,” Hanuwantiya tent city event organizer Hiteshwar Singh said. Only a handful of properties have organised New Year parties while most resorts have decided not to hold and party as a precautionary measure.“We have kept an elaborate menu and scores of adventure activities for tourists for the whole holiday season. We are following all Covid-19 protocols and have increased the interval for sanitisation as a precautionary measure,” Madhya Pradesh Tourism Corporation, Indore regional manager N K Swarnkar said.
summary: Hotels in Madhya Pradesh are fully booked as tourists flock to the state for New Year celebrations, despite a recent rise in Covid-19 cases nationwide. Tourists from Maharashtra and Delhi initially canceled bookings, but local tourists quickly filled the vacancies. Rooms in Madhya Pradesh Tourism Development Corporation properties are sold out until the first week of January, with over 90% occupancy in private resorts. Popular destinations include national parks, Pachmarhi, Orchha, and Hanuwantiya, offering adventure and sports activities. Bookings are also from Gujarat, Kolkata, and Maharashtra. While some properties have organized New Year parties, most have opted for caution, ensuring Covid-19 protocols are followed diligently.

headline: Indian Tech Company Launches Secure Messaging App with End-to-End Encryption
article: On November 28, 2023, an Indian tech company launched a new secure messaging app called "SafeChat," designed to prioritize user privacy and security. SafeChat employs end-to-end encryption to ensure that only the sender and intended recipient can access message contents, protecting user communications from unauthorized access. The app also features additional security measures such as self-destructing messages, two-factor authentication, and biometric lock options for enhanced privacy. SafeChat's user-friendly interface and cross-platform compatibility make it suitable for personal and business communication needs. With growing concerns about data privacy, SafeChat aims to provide a trustworthy platform for secure messaging in an increasingly digital world.
summary: On November 28, 2023, an Indian tech company introduced "SafeChat," a secure messaging app with end-to-end encryption and additional privacy features. SafeChat prioritizes user privacy and security with measures such as self-destructing messages and two-factor authentication. Its user-friendly interface caters to personal and business communication needs, offering a trustworthy platform in today's digital landscape. SafeChat addresses growing concerns about data privacy, providing users with a secure messaging solution for confidential communications.

headline: Airport passenger facility in for quicktime facelift
article:
KOLKATA: A few weeks from now, it will be difficult to recognise the Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport as the staid, austere building it is today. The authorities have kicked off a makeover programme to offer better passenger facilities.The touch-up job will take care of things until the snazzy new terminal comes up, three years down the line. The work has been phased out in terms of â€œshortâ€� and â€œmedium-term improvementsâ€�.
â€œOver the next few months, we will undertake a series of measures that will lead to a striking change in the ambience of the airport and the attitude of our staff. The difference will be felt and seen,â€� assured Kolkata airport director Rajendra Pal.
Work is underway to change the drab, worn-out gray floor of the departure terminal into a bright and shiny one, with brown and white marble tiles in chequered pattern. The dirty, moss-green ceiling has already already been altered to an immaculate white finish.

Illumination has also been improved to impart a bright and cheerful look to the indoor scenery. The signage at the terminal has also been improved to assist passengers.
The toilets are being renovated with new tiles for the floor and walls. And modern sanitaryware has been procured to match the decor. â€œThe whole effort is to make the passage through the terminal buildings a more pleasant and hassle-free experience. International travellers will soon feel a refreshing change at NSCBI Airport,â€� Pal said.


The car park is being revamped to offer more space. In the new set-up, there will be parking space for 307 cars (instead of the existing 250), 110 taxis (in place of 80). There will be new lots for parking of 20 VIP vehicles and 10 coaches.

â€œMajor maintenance and upgrading has been taken up in the airfield. The runway and parking bays are being resurfaced and Category II improved landing system is being installed,â€� he added.


The airport staff is also getting a crash course in polished manners. â€œRegular classes will be conducted to bring about a major attitude change. The staff as well as security persons at frisking points, check-in counters and X-ray terminals will be more pleasant and polite,â€� Pal said.


The airport director is also developing a training programme for taxi drivers. â€œWe received positive feedback from travellers after conducting training camps for cabbies at the Delhi airport,â€� he said.
summary: Kolkata's Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport is undergoing a significant makeover to enhance passenger experience. The short and medium-term improvements include changing the departure terminal's floor to bright brown and white marble tiles, upgrading the ceiling, improving illumination, enhancing signage, and renovating toilets. The car park is being expanded to accommodate more vehicles, and major maintenance is underway in the airfield. Additionally, airport staff is undergoing training for a more pleasant and polite demeanor, and a program for taxi drivers is being developed. The overall goal is to create a more enjoyable and hassle-free experience for travelers.

headline: War with LTTE will be won this year: Lankan PM
article:
Sri Lankan Prime Minister Ratnasiri Wickramanayake said government will not compromise on economic development of the country despite rebel attacks and hoped that the war with LTTE will be won during 2008.

“The security forces and police are now engaged in a successful mission to liberate people in the North from LTTE clutches. There is no doubt that the Government would be able to achieve this objective and provide relief to the people in the North this year”, he said in his New Year message.

“We should recall the liberation of the East from LTTE clutches, creation of an environment for its people to live in freedom and launching of development work as a significant achievement”, Wickramanayake said.

He said the government had not compromised on economic development effort despite the LTTE attacks.

“No other Government had matched the massive development work undertaken by the present Government in such a short time”, he said adding the ‘large amount of foreign aid last year’ also helped in this direction.


President Mahinda Rajapaksa had succeeded in obtaining oil at concession rates and assistance for several other projects from the Iranian Government, the Prime Minister said.

“Let us all eschew petty squabbles and differences and dedicate ourselves to build a society rich in moral and spiritual values by espousing love and compassion”, Wickramanayake said.
summary: Sri Lankan Prime Minister Ratnasiri Wickramanayake expressed the government's unwavering commitment to economic development despite ongoing rebel attacks, particularly by the LTTE. In his New Year message, he reassured that the government was making significant strides to liberate the Northern region from LTTE control and provide relief to its people. He highlighted the successful liberation of the Eastern province from LTTE forces, the subsequent development efforts, and the substantial foreign aid received to bolster these initiatives. Wickramanayake also praised President Mahinda Rajapaksa's efforts to secure oil at concession rates from Iran. He urged the nation to set aside differences and unite for a prosperous society built on moral and spiritual values.

headline: Speculations rife over KCR-Harish Rao ties
article:
It is one month since Chief Minister K. Chandrasekhar Rao and his nephew, former minister T. Harish Rao met, fuelling speculation that there is a widening gap between the two. Neither leader has discussed this issue with other party leaders.

The last time they spoke was on December 11 when the Assembly results were announced. On December 13, Harish Rao attended KCR’s oath taking ceremony as Chief Minister but there was no conversation between the two.

On the second day after he took oath as Chief Minister, Mr Rao held a review meeting on irrigation projects.

Though Harish Rao had been irrigation minister in the previous cabinet and worked hard to complete flagship irrigation projects — even sleeping for some days at the site of the project — Harish Rao was not invited to attend the review meeting.

MR RAO had dissolved the Assembly nine months before schedule and announced the names of 105 party contestants on the same day, unlike the Congress

HAVING REALISED its mistake, the Congress has decided to announce its Lok Sabha candidates in advance.

Telangana Rashtra Samiti president and Chief Minister K. Chandrasekhar Rao has become a trend setter not only in government schemes but also in electoral strategy. With the Rythu Bandhu (farmers’ investment subsidy) scheme Mr Rao attracted national attention.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi is thinking of announcing the same scheme across the country ahead of the Lok Sabha elections.

And Y.S.R. Congress president Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy announced in Ichhapuram on Wednesday that he would implement the same scheme if he is voted to power in the ensuing Andhra Pradesh Assembly elections.

West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee also announced economic assistance to farmers similar to the Rythu Bandhu scheme.

Political parties are also emulating Mr Rao’s strategy of announcing candidates early in the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections and in Andhra Pradesh in the Assembly elections.

Mr Rao had dissolved the Assembly nine months before schedule, on September 6, 2018, and announced the names of 105 party contestants (of a total 119) on the same day.

The People’s Front led by the Congress did not announce its candidates till the last minute.

By then the TRS candidates had completed their first round of campaigning.

Having realised its mistake, the Congress’s central leadership has decided to announce its Lok Sabha candidates in advance and asked all Pradesh Congress Committees (PCCs) across the country to send their candidates’ lists by the end of this month.

Candidates will be announced in a phased manner by the end of February.

Meanwhile, in Andhra Pradesh, the main political parties, the ruling Telugu Desam, and the YSR Congress, the main Opposition party, are considering announcing their candidates in advance, probably in February.

The convener of the People’s Front, Telangana Jana Samiti (TJS) president Kodandaram, recently said that the main reason for the defeat of the People’s Front was delay in announcing the candidates.

The Central Election Commission is likely to announce the election schedule in the last week of February or in the first week of March 2019.
summary: A **month-long silence** between Telangana CM **K. Chandrasekhar Rao** (KCR) and his nephew **T. Harish Rao** has sparked speculation about a **rift within the TRS** leadership. Despite Harish Rao's strong contributions as irrigation minister, he was not invited to a key review meeting. Meanwhile, KCR’s **early candidate announcements and welfare schemes** like **Rythu Bandhu** are influencing other political parties, including the **Congress**, **YSR Congress**, and **TDP**, to adopt **similar electoral strategies**. The **Congress** plans to avoid past mistakes by announcing **Lok Sabha candidates early**, ahead of the **Election Commission's expected schedule** announcement in late February or early March.

headline: CBI books ex-Garrison Engineer, others for Rs 7.84 crore scam in Visakhapatnam Naval Dockyard
article:
NEW DELHI: The CBI has booked a former Garrison Engineer posted at Naval Dockyard, Visakhapatnam and others for allegedly making payments to contractors without execution of tendered work causing a loss of Rs 7.84 crore to the exchequer, officials said Tuesday.

The agency has registered an FIR against Prashant Shivhare, the then Garrison Engineer, who allegedly issued large number of tenders for various works between August 2018 and March 2019, they said.

The accused official in conspiracy with his subordinates and contractors allegedly made payments to the contractors without the completion of tendered work causing a loss of Rs 7.84 crore to the exchequer, they said.

The CBI has also booked contractors and other officials working in the department in three separate cases registered by it under IPC sections related to criminal conspiracy, cheating and others besides provisions of Prevention of Corruption Act, they said.
summary: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has filed an FIR against a former Garrison Engineer, Prashant Shivhare, and others for allegedly making payments to contractors without completing the tendered work, resulting in a loss of Rs 7.84 crore to the exchequer. The accused official is said to have issued numerous tenders for various works between August 2018 and March 2019, and along with his subordinates and contractors, made payments without completing the projects. The CBI has registered three separate cases, including charges related to criminal conspiracy and cheating, along with provisions of the Prevention of Corruption Act.

headline: Rs 926 cr. worth liquor consumed in last four days of 2024
article:
Hyderabad: New Year’s eve would remain incomplete without consumption of liquor for many people in Telangana and so it was in 2024. An indication towards this can be gauged from the fact that people gulped almost Rs 926 crore worth of liquor in the last four days of the year. According to officials from the prohibition and excise department, liquor sales worth Rs 926 crore were recorded from December 28 till the night of December 31 with December 30 recording the highest in terms of volume at Rs 402 crore. Incidentally, sales dipped by 29.85 per cent on December 31 compared to the previous day’s high at Rs 282 crore, which officials attribute to shortage of supply.
While liquor worth Rs 51 crore was sold on December 29, it netted Rs 191 crore on December 28. The entire month of December recorded sales worth Rs 3,615 crore. This shows that around 25.6 per cent of liquor was purchased and consumed in the last four days of the month, nay year. However, this is lower than the sale recorded in December 2023, which was estimated at Rs 4,274 crore, while it was a mindboggling Rs 31,000 crore in 2022 December
Excise officials said that around 50 per cent of the liquor that was sold in the state was consumed by people in Hyderabad and Rangareddy districts. Meanwhile, the Telangana Anti-Narcotics Bureau (TGANB), in a joint operation with the excise department, the SOT and the local police caught five persons, who were allegedly under the influence of drugs. No person was caught under the influence of drugs in 2023. According to TGANB director Sandeep Shandilya, none of the DJs at any pub tested positive.
summary: Telangana witnessed liquor sales worth ₹926 crore in just the last four days of December 2024, with December 30 alone contributing ₹402 crore, marking the highest single-day sales. Despite a 29.85% dip on New Year’s Eve due to supply issues, December's total sales reached ₹3,615 crore, with nearly 25.6% of sales occurring in the final four days. However, this was lower than ₹4,274 crore in December 2023 and ₹31,000 crore in 2022. Hyderabad and Rangareddy districts accounted for nearly 50% of sales. The Telangana Anti-Narcotics Bureau also reported five drug-related arrests during New Year celebrations, a rise from zero in 2023.

headline: Deepika Padukone regrets not meeting Suchitra Sen
article:
Mumbai: We hear Deepika Padukone, who was recently shooting for Piku in Kolkata, made time to explore the city that has a rich cinematic history. A source from the film’s unit says, "The only regret Deepika has is visiting the city after the demise of veteran actress Suchitra Sen. Deepika has always been a huge admirer of Suchitra Sen not only because she was a great actress, but also because Deepika feels that Sen was the most beautiful woman of the golden era of cinema."

For a long time Deepika harboured a wish to meet Sen in Kolkata. Unfortunately, the visit only happened after the veteran actress expired earlier this year. The source adds, "Deepika dropped in at her house and also took time to visit the homes of other legends including Satyajit Ray. She had a lovely time in Kolkata but said that would always regret not having the opportunity to interact with Sen."
summary: Deepika Padukone, while shooting for the film "Piku" in Kolkata, expressed her regret over not meeting the legendary actress Suchitra Sen, who had passed away earlier that year. Deepika visited Sen's house and other iconic locations in the city, expressing her admiration for Sen's beauty and acting prowess from the golden era of cinema. She had always wished to meet Sen in person, and the visit took place posthumously.

headline: Mukti Mohan ties the knot with Kunal Thakur, shares dreamy wedding pictures: 'In you, I find my divine connection'
article:
Dancer and actor Mukti Mohan tied the knot with her beau and actor Kunal Thakur. On Sunday, the couple took to their social media and shared some dreamy wedding pictures from their intimate ceremony attended by only family and close friends. The couple looked adorable in a pastel-themed wedding and also shared a heartfelt note as they began their journey as husband and wife. 

Mukti Mohan tied the knot with actor Kunal Thakur on Sunday in an intimate but dreamy wedding. The couple opted for a pastel-themed wedding. While Mukti was seen wearing a pastel pink lehenga, Kunal donned a white sherwani for the big day. 

Along with the beautiful and dreamy wedding pictures Mukti Mohan also penned a heartwarming note which read, "In you, I find my divine connection; with you, my union is destined. Grateful for the blessings bestowed by god, family, and friends. Our families are ecstatic and seek your blessings for our journey forward as Husband and Wife." 

The couple shared some pictures from their pheras and they looked adorable. The two could be seen hugging each other and flashing their million dollar smiles in the photos.
summary: Dancer and actor Mukti Mohan married actor Kunal Thakur in an intimate ceremony attended by family and close friends. The couple shared dreamy wedding pictures featuring a pastel-themed celebration. Mukti wore a pastel pink lehenga, while Kunal donned a white sherwani. Mukti expressed gratitude in a heartfelt note, stating, "In you, I find my divine connection; with you, my union is destined." The couple sought blessings for their journey as husband and wife.

headline: 24-hr power supply for clusters of border villages
article:
Amritsar, December 31
To implement the next year’s theme of administrative reforms, Chief Minister Parkash Singh Badal held a meeting of district administrative officials here today.

Terming the meeting as Sangat Darshan with officials, Badal asked for their views on more convenient ways for implementing social welfare schemes. He said the aim of the meeting was to collect the views of the officials on hindrances blocking the implementation of social welfare schemes and denying percolating of benefits to the masses.

He also released state government’s new year diary.

Badal also held a Sangat Darshan programme in the border village of Kakkar Kalan, which falls in Ajnala block. He announced that small clusters of villages along the international border with Pakistan would be given 24-hour uninterrupted electricity supply. Earlier, the facility was extended to the cluster having at least five or more houses.

Later, the CM participated in the International Valmiki Conference organised by the Adi Dharam Samaj.
summary: Chief Minister Parkash Singh Badal conducted a meeting with district administrative officials in Amritsar to discuss the theme of administrative reforms for the next year. Describing it as a Sangat Darshan with officials, he sought their opinions on efficient ways to implement social welfare schemes. The focus was on identifying obstacles hindering the implementation of these schemes. Badal also announced 24-hour electricity supply for small clusters of villages along the international border with Pakistan during a Sangat Darshan program in Kakkar Kalan. Later, he participated in the International Valmiki Conference organized by the Adi Dharam Samaj.

headline: Market Rally: Optimising Investment Strategy; Large-cap funds a prudent choice now
article:
As the benchmark indices touch new highs, individuals need to be prudent about their exposure to equities by
increasing investments in large-cap stocks now as mid-caps and small-caps look overbought suggesting potential
risks, say experts. Many large-cap stocks are seeing robust earnings growth and their valuations are around the longterm average.
The large-caps offer a relatively cheaper investment option compared to mid- and small-caps and would benefit once
interest rates start falling next year. This underlines the importance of prioritising large-cap investments in
anticipation of better returns. Also, large-cap stocks or funds are ideal for new investors as a higher level of due
diligence is needed to differentiate between fundamentally good companies and stocks that are rallying without the
basis of underlying business performance.Nirav Karkera, head, Research, Fisdom, says, when the tide rises and lifts all boats, it is all the more important to be
sure about valuations in the context of headroom for further growth. “Large-caps appear better positioned to benefit
from incremental investor interest in the shorter to medium term,” he saysSimilarly, Harish Menon, co-founder and head of Investments and product research, House of Alpha, says opting for
large-cap stocks appears to be a prudent choice at this juncture. “If foreign investors resume a net buying position,
their focus would primarily be on large-cap stocks in the forthcoming months.”
Weed out the laggards
An investor can consider to exit a fund if it underperforms its benchmark and category over a period of two to three
years. For example, in large-cap funds, the difference between the top performing and the worst performing fund is
14 percentage points over a three-year period.
Even if initial investment choices were flawed, the upswing provides a chance to rectify errors and exit with gains. This
proactive approach allows for the optimisation of portfolios, ensuring a strategic alignment with robust stocks or
funds.
Soumya Sarkar, co-founder, Wealth Redefine, says during bull markets, one should exit unfavourable positions and
pivot toward sound investments. “Identifying subpar stocks or funds presents an opportunity to sell during bullish
phases, locking in profits. By doing so, investors can strategically reallocate funds into more promising assets during
subsequent market downturns,” he says.
Booking profits need a good strategy as sometimes there can be reinvestment risk. “Rebalancing of the portfolio can
be done in such a way where the asset allocation can be realigned not by redeeming but investing in asset classes
where the allocation needs to increase,” says Harshad Chetanwala, co-founder, MyWealthGrowth.com.
Continue with SIPs: Systematic investment plans work in all market conditions without worrying about market levels.
So, despite the surge in the markets, one can start a new SIP or continue with SIPs without thinking too much about
the market. Give sufficient time to these investments to grow. Those seeking to deploy incremental amounts through
SIPs to capture near-term buying opportunities, and as an allocation to the satellite segment of the portfolio, can
maintain a large-cap orientation while being neutral-weighted to mid- and small-cap allocations.
Avoid FOMO in stocks: Investors should stay away from the fear of missing out of investing directly in stocks. It is
important to recognise the cyclical nature of equities and invest based only on conviction derived through thorough
analysis.
summary: Amid soaring benchmark indices, financial experts advise caution and recommend a shift towards large-cap stocks over mid-caps and small-caps, cautioning of potential risks in the latter due to overvaluation. Large-caps, offering a relatively cheaper investment option with robust earnings growth, are seen as better positioned for potential benefits when interest rates decline. Emphasizing the importance of thorough due diligence, experts suggest prioritizing large-cap investments, especially for new investors. Nirav Karkera of Fisdom advocates assessing valuations for further growth opportunities. Harish Menon from House of Alpha suggests that large-cap stocks are prudent choices, particularly if foreign investors resume net buying positions. Investors are advised to exit underperforming funds based on benchmark and category comparisons over two to three years. This market surge provides an opportunity to rectify flawed investments and strategically reallocate funds into promising assets during subsequent market downturns. Strategies for booking profits include strategic reallocation through rebalancing portfolios and continuing systematic investment plans (SIPs) irrespective of market conditions, allowing investments to grow over time. Additionally, investors are cautioned against succumbing to the fear of missing out (FOMO) and advised to invest based on conviction derived from thorough analysis, avoiding speculative tendencies during market cycles.

headline: Export growth slows to 5-month low of 5.86 per cent in Nov.
article:
Export growth eased to a five-month low of 5.86 per cent in November due to a fall in shipments of petroleum goods and rough diamonds, although the trade deficit narrowed as gold imports declined.

"Three product categories (petroleum goods, gems and jewellery and pharmaceuticals) have pulled down our exports," Commerce Secretary S R Rao said, adding that these sectors have a major contribution in the country's export basket. India's exports stood at USD 24.6 billion in November 2013 as against US $ 23.25 billion in the same month last year.

However, a 16.3 per cent decline in imports particularly gold and silver during the month helped in narrowing the trade deficit to US $ 9.21 billion in November, which is second lowest level during the ongoing fiscal.

In September, the trade gap fell to USD 6.76 billion. Imports in November stood at USD 33.83 billion, which is the lowest figure since March 2011. Trade deficit in November 2012 was at US $ 17.2 billion. Gold and silver imports in November dipped by 80.49 per cent to US $ 1.05 billion from USD 5.4 billion in the same period last year. Oil imports too dipped by 1.1 per cent to USD 12.96 billion during the month. Rao said that gems and jewellery exports declined due to increase in the prices of rough diamonds.

"The cost of rough diamonds have gone up significantly as a result of which traders did not purchase the diamonds during November. And as regards to petroleum products, I believe couple of refineries were shut (due to maintenance). Also, there has been reduction in pharmaceutical exports," he said.

Commenting on the figures, Apparel Export Promotion Council Chairman A Sakthivel said in the coming months exports would pick up fast. In April-November 2013, exports grew by 6.27 per cent to US $ 204 billion while imports aggregated at USD 304 billion. Trade deficit for the period stands at USD 100 billion.
summary: India's export growth slowed to 5.86% in November, a five-month low, primarily due to reduced shipments of petroleum products and rough diamonds. However, the trade deficit narrowed due to a 16.3% decline in imports, particularly of gold and silver. Importantly, gold and silver imports fell by 80.49%. Despite the challenges, India's exports in November 2013 were $24.6 billion compared to $23.25 billion in the same month the previous year. The Apparel Export Promotion Council Chairman expects export figures to improve in the upcoming months. In the April-November period, exports grew by 6.27%, with a trade deficit of $100 billion.

headline: Congress questions airport pacts with Changi  Read more at: http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/articleshow/50146320.cms?utm_source=contentofinterest&utm_medium=text&utm_campaign=cppst
article:
NEW DELHI: Congress has questioned the BJP government’s decision to hand over Ahmedabad and Jaipur
airports to Singapore’s Changi Airport Group for managing operations.
Calling it “surprising and shocking”, Ahmed Patel, political secretary to Congress chief Sonia Gandhi, also
questioned why due process that encourages competition was avoided in handing over the two airports.
In a letter to civil aviation minister Ashok Gajapati Raju, Patel said the government decided to abruptly cancel the
entire process of competitive bidding for the operation, management and development of Ahmedabad, Jaipur,
Chennai and Kolkata airports on September 20.
He said the Centre, through a government-to-government MoU, decided to award the same mandate to a
foreign operator for Ahmedabad and Jaipur airports.
“I find it surprising that without any explicit change in policy, the government bypassed due process and has
abruptly selected an operator to manage India’s two most important airports,” Patel said.
“The closed nature in which the government arrived at this crucial decision is beyond reasonable
comprehension,” he added.
Given that Airports Authority of India (AAI) initially intended to develop four airports, Patel asked, “Why has the
MoU covered only two airports? Such display of arbitrariness on a matter of importance is baffling.”
The senior Congress functionary also asked whether AAI was taken into confidence. “Why was due process which
encourages competition avoided for the handover of these airports? Was AAI taken into confidence,” he asked.
6/11/24, 3:38 PM Congress questions airport pacts with Changi - Times of India
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/congress-questions-airport-pacts-with-changi/articleshowprint/50146320.cms 1/2
Highlighting that the UPA government had a consistent policy on developing vital airport infrastructure, he said,
“Transparency and accountability must be the cornerstone for any policy on public infrastructure.”
summary: The Congress party has raised concerns about the BJP government's decision to award the management of Ahmedabad and Jaipur airports to Singapore's Changi Airport Group without competitive bidding. Ahmed Patel, political secretary to Congress chief Sonia Gandhi, criticized the lack of transparency and competition in the process. He questioned why the government abruptly canceled the competitive bidding process for four airports and instead opted for a government-to-government MoU to hand over the management mandate for Ahmedabad and Jaipur airports to a foreign operator. Patel highlighted the importance of transparency and accountability in public infrastructure policies, citing the consistent approach of the UPA government. He also questioned why only two airports were covered by the MoU instead of all four initially intended by the Airports Authority of India (AAI), and whether AAI was consulted in the decision-making process. Patel emphasized the need for due process and competition in such significant decisions involving vital infrastructure assets.
